alert.note: Alert for Grainger; Jefferson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 5:15AM CDT until August 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Grainger, Jefferson, Knox and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area in the next hour or two. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Sevierville, Jefferson City, Gatlinburg, Dandridge, Pigeon Forge, New Market, Strawberry Plains, Blaine, Pittman Center, Kodak, Piedmont, McMahan, Harrisburg, Fairgarden, Kimberlin Heights, Bird Crossing, Seymour, Chestnut Hill and Mascot. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
